SENT.plain: The constitutional pericentric inversion on chromosome 3, inv(3), is rarely found in a normal population
The aim of our study was to investigate its possible link to hematologic malignancy
Chromosomes from bone marrow cells in 890 patients with hematologic disorders were analyzed with the Q-banding technique
In 241 patients with myelodysplastic syndromes the frequency was 6.2% as opposed to 2.9% in the remaining 649 patients (p=0.02)
The increased frequency of inv(3) in patients with myelodysplastic syndromes indicates that inv(3) could be a risk factor for the development of the disease
